item.title: Welcome to { Personal } Jekyll Theme!
item.description: Click the view more posts link bellow, to see the currently available post-tutorials to help you get your { Personal } website up and running quicker!

item.title: Modifying the HTML HEAD
item.description: In the _config.yml, find and set the variables of the Head section:

item.title: Modifying the Intro
item.description: The intro part of the index page is consisted of three elements:

item.title: Setting up the Blog
item.description: A website is truly personal if it's your blog as well, this place of the internet where you can place your thoughts about anything!

item.title: Writing posts
item.description: Every file with the format YYYY-MM-DD-.markup will be processed as a post, with publication date YYYY-MM-DD.

item.title: Generating your Blog's RSS feed
item.description: Sit back, build the jekyll theme and it will be autogenerated in /feed.xml!

item.title: Adding a life event
item.description: One of the cool features of { Personal } is that enables you to tell your life's story in the form of a timeline of photos, dates and text descriptions. Let's see how it works.

item.title: Modifying the social buttons
item.description: Social buttons (rendered in the footer) are great for having a small hub with all your social footprint. In order to change them, go to _config.yml and edit the social list:

item.description: The contact part of the index page is consisted of two elements:

item.description: You can change the text from the 404.html file and set the image from the _config.yml:
